channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: California plans to revoke 17,000 commercial driver's licenses given to immigrants
item.description: The announcement follows harsh criticism from the Trump administration about California and other states granting licenses to people in the country il...

item.title: Why home insurance is unaffordable, even in places without wildfires or hurricanes
item.description: Some of the country's highest home insurance prices are in the central U.S., a region generally considered to be protected from climate-driven disaste...

item.title: Israel deported Palestinian prisoners to Egypt. Some Israelis question the practice
item.description: Israel deported more than 150 freed Palestinian prisoners last month. Some experts in Israel warn it could have long-term consequences for Israeli sec...

item.title: SNAP funding pause to soon end, but anxiety and anger may linger
item.description: The first ever disruption to the nation's largest anti-hunger program came as a shock. It's shaken trust in the program for some and stoked concern th...

item.title: 'We need to get out of here': Trump's immigration crackdown is quietly reshaping where immigrants live in America
item.description: The Trump administration says that more than 1.6 million immigrants have self-deported. But there's also evidence of an internal migration from target...

item.title: 11/12: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: House to vote on ending government shutdown; Jeffrey Epstein said Trump "knew about the girls" in 2019 email to author Michael Wolff

item.title: France remembers Bataclan attacks but knows enemy has not gone away
item.description: As France marks 10 years since the Paris attacks, an ex-girlfriend of a jihadist survivor is arrested for an alleged plot of her own.

item.title: Lawyers for Comey, Letitia James to tell court their cases should be dismissed
item.description: Lawyers for James Comey and Letitia James are arguing their indictments should be dismissed because the appointment of the interim U.S. attorney in Vi...

item.title: South Sudan leader sacks powerful vice-president in shock move
item.description: Bol Mel, who is sanctioned by the US for alleged corruption, had been tipped as Kiir's successor.

item.title: 11/12: CBS Evening News
item.description: House gavels in for vote to end longest shutdown in U.S. history; Essay: What comes next after the shutdown ends

item.title: Popular rapper freed on bail in probe of influencer's death
item.description: Rapper Namewee was named a "person of interest" in an investigation into the death of Taiwanese influencer Iris Hsieh, police said.

item.title: Anthony Zurcher: Democrats left bruised after historic shutdown yields little
item.description: Trump emerges from the shutdown having made little in the way of substantive concessions to Democrats in Congress.

item.title: Thousands of unionized Starbucks workers to strike Thursday over contract deal
item.description: Starbucks Workers United is calling the strike the "red cup rebellion," since the strike coincides with the coffee chain's annual Red Cup Day promotio...

item.title: Over 200 Kenyans fighting for Russia in Ukraine - minister
item.description: Russian recruitment networks are targeting Kenyans with fake job offers, authorities say.

item.title: PC gaming giant Valve unveils new console to rival Xbox and PlayStation
item.description: The Steam Machine is a console designed to allow gamers to play PC games on their TV.

item.title: Judge signals hundreds of people detained in Chicago immigration crackdown could be released on bond
FAA says flight cuts will stay at 6% because more air traffic controllers are coming to work
The timeline for SNAP benefits remains uncertain, even as the government is set to reopen
item.description: President Donald Trump has signed a measure to reopen the government and resume full food aid benefits that were paused at the start of November.
